comment: Cooper was great! If you want a good instructor who will answer any questions you have in lab, take Cooper! He isn't inaccessible, he just replies to emails AFTER his classes, but if you get lost in his email feed, it might take awhile. The best way to ask questions is in class or go to his office hours. Overall, TAKE HIM FOR AN EASY A.

He was a good professor. i learned a lot from him and he would explain things very well. but he is a very tough grader. he gives good feedback on your assignments. also when its and assignment where you first have to turn in a first draft he gives you a lot of feed back so you can do better on your final draft.
Inaccessible outside of class, feeding structure all over the place - at times he would nit pick, other times he would blow through it. Communication was next to nonexistent.

The coursework itself can be a little challenging if you slack off but if you actually try to do well on assignments and put in the work you'll get an A. He's very easy to reach by email and is always willing to answer questions or help you out if you are struggling with an assignment. The coding part of the lab sucks but i promise it gets better!

He is very sweet and genuine outside of class, he expects things to be done very cut and dry but takes the time to help you! As I'm writing this, he is helping me with my manuscript right now. If you want an A, it is reachable!

very nice and helpful. I had a mental breakdown the night before an assignment was due and I spoke to him how I was having trouble and he gave me more time to finish the assignment. If you have a question he will most def help. He's just a TA right now and very young, but seems genuine and charismatic.

Hot professor is all i can say. He is a tough grader and isn't much help. we technically had to do everything on our own with little to no help from him. He is funny and outgoing though. i hated the excel sheets that he just assumed we were supposed to be great with omg.

Cooper was super sweet and interacted with his students it was never a dull moment in class. Even though he was only a TA he'd make a great professor someday. I registered for a professor but got him instead: I got lucky
